sn17.13-20:1.5: The Purāṇas list the _nikkha_ (“ingot”) as the largest gold coin, but here a _siṅgīnikkha_ must be much more than a hundred of the largest coins, and hence cannot be a coin at all. _Siṅgīsuvaṇṇa_ means “mountain gold” ([an3.70:38.3]()). Given that the next step is the entire earth, perhaps _siṅgīnikkha_ means a “golden mountain”.
